Class PieceActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • mayflower.Actor
      • PieceActor

  • public class PieceActor
extends mayflower.Actor
    A Mayflower Actor that represents a spot on the board. This Actor can display an X, an O, or a blank space

      • PieceActor

        public PieceActor(TicTacToeStage stage,
                  int row,
                  int col)
        Create a new PieceActor object
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage this PieceActor will be added to
        row - This PieceActor's row
        col - This PieceActor's col

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Checks if this piece is clicked using the isClicked() method If this piece is clicked is clicked then: 1. Check if the game is over. No pieces can be played if the game is over. 1. Check if this is an empty piece. Pieces cannot be played on top of other pieces. 2. Make this PieceActor display the current player's piece. 3. Tell the game to put the current player's piece in the correct row,col using the addPiece() method. 3. Tell the game it is the next player's turn using the nextPlayer() method.
        Specified by:
        update in class mayflower.Actor

      • setPiece

        public void setPiece(TicTacToePiece piece)
        Set the piece that this PieceActor should be displaying.
        Parameters:
        piece - The TicTacToePiece that this PieceActor should display. null for blank.
